info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 5:43PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Scattered snow showers and gusty winds will continue moving through Southwest Montana through the evening hours... Scattered snow showers and gusty westerly winds in excess of 40 mph at times will impact Southwest Montana for the remainder of the evening. Total snow accumulations up to 3 inches will be possible at pass level, particularly over Big Hole and Chief Joseph Pass. Impacts will include slippery roads and reduced visibility down to a mile or less with the heavier snow showers. Snow impacts will mostly be over the mountain passes, but lower elevations may see brief periods of reduced visibility and minor snow accumulations as well. Anyone traveling this evening should be prepared for potential rapid changes to wintry driving conditions over short distances.
